intro: Psychotria alata var. pubescens, commonly known as the creeping evergreen or the velvetleaf psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Central and South America, particularly found in tropical regions with high humidity. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves that are covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a velvety texture. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, which bloom throughout the year in warm climates. This plant is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various soil types.
